abstract.p: The Churn column on recent executive appointments (M)�

block.p: Evercore Partners has hired two investment bankers as senior managing directors: François Maisonrouge, who had been a managing director and chairman of life sciences at Credit Suisse, and Mark Vander Ploeg, who was previously a vice chairman of investment banking at Merrill Lynch.

Evercore Partners has hired two investment bankers as senior managing directors: François Maisonrouge, who had been a managing director and chairman of life sciences at Credit Suisse, and Mark Vander Ploeg, who was previously a vice chairman of investment banking at Merrill Lynch.
Paul Calderone, formerly of Morgan Stanley, has joined Credit Suisse as product manager for balanced alpha products.
Cowen Group has hired John Nelson, formerly of Friedman Billings Ramsey, and appointed Charles Preusse as co-heads of aerospace and defense investment banking.
Thomas Johnston, formerly of Miller & Chevalier, has joined Shearman & Sterling as a partner in its tax group in the Washington office.

Brendon J. Weiss has joined the lobbying and consulting firm Porterfield & Lowenthal as a vice president. He recently served in the Securities and Exchange Commission's office of legislative and intergovernmental affairs.
Shannon Lowry Nagle, formerly of Stroock & Stroock & Lavan, has joined the New York office of O'Melveny & Myers as a partner in the business restructuring and reorganization group.
GE Commercial Finance Corporate Lending has appointed Kjerstin E. Barley senior vice president and industry leader of technology and electronics.

Clifford Chance has named eight new counsels in the United States: Joseph T. Calto, David Cook, Jeffrey Gimpel, Mark Rueh and Mandy Stupart, all in New York; and Boyd Cloern, Jeffrey Drichta and Fabricio Longhin in the firm's Washington office.

Robert S. Loigman, who specializes in hedge fund and other securities cases, is joining the New York office of Quinn Emanuel Urquhart Oliver & Hedges as a partner. Mr. Loigman was previously a partner with Friedman Kaplan Seiler & Adelman.
Jeff S. Liebmann, Jonathan L. Freedman and Jonathan J. Kelly have joined Sidley Austin as partners in the global insurance practice in New York.
